metadata.title: CVE-2017-5848 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.description:
The gst_ps_demux_parse_psm function in gst/mpegdemux/gstmpegdemux.c in gst-plugins-bad in GStreamer allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (invalid memory read and crash) via vectors involving PSM parsing. Hanno Böck discovered that GStreamer Bad Plug-ins incorrectly handled vectors involving PSM parsing. A remote attacker could exploit this with a crafted media file to cause GStreamer to crash, resulting in a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2017-5848` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-gst-plugins-bad-1.0 - 1.14.1-1ubuntu1~ubuntu18.04.1
gstreamer1.0-opencv - 1.14.1-1ubuntu1~ubuntu18.04.1
gstreamer1.0-plugins-bad - 1.14.1-1ubuntu1~ubuntu18.04.1
gstreamer1.0-plugins-bad-apps - 1.14.1-1ubuntu1~ubuntu18.04.1
gstreamer1.0-wpe - 1.14.1-1ubuntu1~ubuntu18.04.1
libgstreamer-opencv1.0-0 - 1.14.1-1ubuntu1~ubuntu18.04.1
libgstreamer-plugins-bad1.0-0 - 1.14.1-1ubuntu1~ubuntu18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gst-plugins-bad1.0 package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.14.1-1ubuntu1~ubuntu18.04.1').
